title: Fix Demo & Media image not loading and re-add asset

requirements.text: Re-add the user-uploaded demo image asset to the frontend static assets so it is present in production and matches the path referenced by the app (currently `frontend/src/siteConfig.ts` uses `/assets/whatsapp-image-2026-02-06-092349.jpeg`).

quotes: re add the image it still not opening

acceptanceCriteria: The file exists at the expected public path at build time (e.g., `frontend/public/assets/whatsapp-image-2026-02-06-092349.jpeg`) and is included in the production build output.
Loading the image URL in the deployed app returns HTTP 200 and displays the image (no broken image icon).

requirements.text: Make Demo & Media image URLs robust to the deployed base path by resolving `siteConfig.media.images` entries using the app base URL (avoid hard-coded leading `/` paths that can break in production).

quotes: re add the image it still not opening

acceptanceCriteria: With the deployed canister URL (including any subpath/base), the demo image renders correctly without manual refreshes or URL edits.

`frontend/src/siteConfig.ts` and the DemoMedia section use a consistent convention (either relative paths like `assets/...` or base-url-resolved absolute URLs) so the image works in local dev and production.

requirements.text: In `frontend/src/components/sections/DemoMediaSection.tsx`, add a user-friendly fallback when an image fails to load (e.g., show a short English error message and/or a placeholder block instead of a broken image).

quotes: re add the image it still not opening

acceptanceCriteria: If the image URL is invalid, the UI shows an English fallback state (not an empty/broken image) while keeping the rest of the section usable.
The console does not show uncaught runtime errors from image load failures.

requirements.text: Allow users to open the demo image at full size by making each Demo & Media image clickable (open the original image URL in a new tab/window).

quotes: re add the image it still not opening

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking a demo image opens the full-resolution image in a new browser tab (with appropriate `target`/`rel` attributes).
This works for all entries in `siteConfig.media.images`.

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only shadcn/ui sources).
Keep the backend architecture unchanged (no new canisters/services).
nonGoals: Adding new media types beyond the existing `videoUrl` and `images` fields.
Changing the content of the landing page sections unrelated to Demo & Media.
